text.div:
NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
HIVG 0..*BaseHIV.G Diagnostics Logical Model
Instances of this logical model are not marked to be the target of a Reference
cd4Count 1..1stringCD4 count
cd4CellPercentage 1..1stringCD4 cell percentage
baselineCd4Count 1..1stringBaseline CD4 count

firstViralLoadTestResult 1..1stringFirst viral load test result
viralLoadTestResult 1..1stringViral load test result

hbsagNegative 1..1stringNegative

hbStockOutOrExpired 1..1stringStock-out or expired
hbMachineOrTechnicianNAOrNotFunctioning 1..1stringMachine or technician not available or machine not functioning
hbClientDeclinedRefusedTest 1..1stringClient declined / refused test
hbOther 1..1stringOther
hbOtherSpecify 1..1stringOther (specify)

hepatitisBPositive 1..1stringHepatitis B positive
hepatitisBNegative 1..1stringHepatitis B negative

reasonHepatitisCTestNotDone 1..1stringReason Hepatitis C test not done

hepatitisCNegative 1..1stringHepatitis C negative

Documentation for this format

name: HIVG
title: HIV.G Diagnostics Logical Model
description: Logical Model for HIV.G Diagnostics data elements.

element.definition: Logical Model for HIV.G Diagnostics data elements.
CD4 cell count in cells/mm^3
CD4 cell percentage
CD4 result from first CD4 test performed (such as at treatment initiation), also may be called CD4 at ART initiation or at ART start

element.short: Date of baseline CD4 count sample collection
element.definition: Date and time when baseline CD4 count test sample was collected
The clients first CD4 count from baseline CD4 test performed (such as at treatment initiation) was a count of <200 cells/mm3
Date sample to be used for CD4 count was collected
A viral load test was performed

element.short: Date of viral load sample collection
element.definition: Date and time when the sample was collected to test the clients HIV viral load

element.short: Date of first viral load sample collection
element.definition: Date and time when the sample was collected to test the clients HIV viral load for the first time
Date viral load sample sent to the lab
Result from the initial viral load test in number of copies/mL
Result from the viral load test in number of copies/mL
The type of specimen to be used to test viral load

element.short: Liquid plasma specimen for viral load testing
element.definition: Liquid plasma and using ethylenediaminetetraacetic acid (EDTA) or plasma preparation tubes for viral load test
Dried blood spot specimen (DBS) for viral load test

element.short: Dried plasma spot from a plasma separation card
element.definition: Dried plasma spot from a plasma separation card for viral load test
Date client was tested for hepatitis B virus (HBV)
Hepatitis B virus test result (HBsAg)
HBsAg test result was positive
HBsAg test result was negative
HBsAg test result was indeterminate

element.short: Reason Hepatitis B test not conducted
element.definition: Reason why a hepatitis B test was not done

element.short: Test delayed to next contact or referred
element.definition: Test has been delayed to the next contact or client was referred to another provider/facility
Test out of stock or stock present but expired

element.short: Machine or technician not available or machine not functioning
element.definition: Test machine or technician is unavailable, or machine is not functioning
Client declined or refused test being undertaken
Other reason test not performed
Other reason test not performed (specify)
Clients hepatitis B diagnosis
Client is positive for Hepatitis B
Client is negative for Hepatitis B
Date when client was screened for HCV
Hepatitis C test has been ordered
Whether a hepatitis C test was conducted

element.short: Reason Hepatitis C test not done
element.definition: Reason why a hepatitis C test was not done

element.short: Test delayed to next contact or referred
element.definition: Test has been delayed to the next contact or client was referred to another provider/facility
Test out of stock or stock present but expired

element.short: Machine or technician not available or machine not functioning
element.definition: Test machine or technician is unavailable, or machine is not functioning
Client declined or refused test being undertaken
Other reason test not performed
Other reason test not performed (specify)
Date client was tested for hepatitis C virus (HCV antibody, HCV RNA or HCV core antigen)
Hepatitis C virus test result (HCV antibody, HCV RNA or HCV core antigen)
HCV test result was positive
HCV test result was negative
HCV test result was indeterminate
Hepatitis C viral load test date
Hepatitis C viral load test result (qualitative)
HCV was detected
HCV was not detected
Clients hepatitis C diagnosis
Client is positive for hepatitis C
Client is negative for hepatitis C
Syphilis test is required
Type of diagnostic test used for syphilis (treponema pallidum)
Treponemal test used
Non-treponemal test used
Point-of-care (POC) test used
Nucleic Acid Amplification Test (NAAT) used
Other test used
Other test used (specify)
Reason why a syphilis test was not done

element.short: Test delayed to next contact or referred
element.definition: Test has been delayed to the next contact or client was referred to another provider/facility
Test out of stock or stock present but expired

element.short: Machine or technician not available or machine not functioning
element.definition: Test machine or technician is unavailable, or machine is not functioning
Client declined or refused test being undertaken
Other reason test not performed
Other reason test not performed (specify)
Date of syphilis test
Result from syphilis test
Test result is positive for syphilis
Test result is negative for syphilis
Test result is inconclusive
Clients syphilis diagnosis
Client is positive for syphilis
Client is negative for syphilis
If the health worker performed other tests on the woman that are not explicitly listed in the application, select "yes" here and fill in the details below.
Input the name of other test(s) that were done.
Input the date of other test(s) that were done.
Input the result from the test(s).
